=== Testing new environment variables functionality ===

1. Normal execution (hide_values=False):
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Auto-generated script for n8n Python Function (Raw)

import json
import sys

# Environment variables (from credentials and system)
API_KEY = 'secret123'
DB_HOST = 'localhost'
PORT = '5432'
SOME_VAR = 'with-dashes'
env_123_INVALID = 'starts-with-number'

# Individual variables from first input item
name = 'test'
value = 123

# Legacy support: input_items and env_vars objects
input_items = [{'name': 'test', 'value': 123}]
env_vars = {'API_KEY': 'secret123', 'DB_HOST': 'localhost', 'PORT': '5432', 'SOME-VAR': 'with-dashes', '123_INVALID': 'starts-with-number'}
# User code starts here
print('Hello world')


============================================================

2. With hidden values (hide_values=True):
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Auto-generated script for n8n Python Function (Raw)

import json
import sys

# Environment variables (from credentials and system)
API_KEY = "***hidden***"
DB_HOST = "***hidden***"
PORT = "***hidden***"
SOME_VAR = "***hidden***"
env_123_INVALID = "***hidden***"

# Individual variables from first input item
name = "***hidden***"
value = "***hidden***"

# Legacy support: input_items and env_vars objects
input_items = "***hidden***"
env_vars = "***hidden***"
# User code starts here
print('Hello world')


============================================================

3. With legacy support disabled (include_legacy=False):
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Auto-generated script for n8n Python Function (Raw)

import json
import sys

# Environment variables (from credentials and system)
API_KEY = 'secret123'
DB_HOST = 'localhost'
PORT = '5432'
SOME_VAR = 'with-dashes'
env_123_INVALID = 'starts-with-number'

# Individual variables from first input item
name = 'test'
value = 123

# User code starts here
print('Hello world')


============================================================

4. With empty environment variables:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Auto-generated script for n8n Python Function (Raw)

import json
import sys

# Individual variables from first input item
name = 'test'
value = 123

# Legacy support: input_items and env_vars objects
input_items = [{'name': 'test', 'value': 123}]
env_vars = {}
# User code starts here
print('Hello world')
